page.title: 09EVERARD'S HAULAGE,NORTH KYME
page.content: The company in it's present form was started in 1932.Mr Everard's father began the company with a horse & cart and when Mr.Everard was old enough,they went into partnership.The company has 18 trucks which includes 14 tractor units with 24 trailers,8 of which are refridgerated,& 4 rigids.At the moment 24 people work there.The trailers are mainly used for taking local produce to markets at London,Manchester,Liverpool and Birmingham.The trailers usually carry potatoes and other vegetables.Chickens are also taken to a local poultry processing unit,and frozen ones taken to supermarkets.Seed potatoes are also brought down from Scotland in the winter.The company does all it's own maintenance.
